lexUnit.name: tumbler.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a drinking glass with straight sides and no handle or stem. formerly having a rounded bottom so as not to stand upright.

sentence.text: A croissant warm from the oven , a cup of good coffee and a tumbler of just-squeezed orange juice costs under £1 .
The packet contained two smaller packets -- one blue , one white , which were mixed together in a tumbler of water .
Our regulars come in , nod , put down a pound and are given a tumbler of the fizzing pick-me-up with no words being spoken .
A Scottish Corporal waved at Marius and handed over two tumblers of neat Malibu which we swigged quickly .
Because you lost so much body water in the heat , small boys brought tumblers of iced water at the end of every set .
He drew a deep breath and reached for the tumbler of Scotch beside him .
Markby put down his tumbler on a small table , laden with copies of The Field .
She reached for the bottle and half filled his tumbler .
Markby drained his tumbler and stood up .
Put the sugar , mint and a little soda into a tall tumbler .
Michelle raised his own tumbler .
The tumbler in his right hand was almost empty .
It 's a long way through the massive forests of larch and pine to Novosibirsk , especially if your travelling companion only grunts as he downs another tumbler of cheap vodka .
Markby cupped his hands round the tumbler of tawny liquid .
You may also want to have a tumbler of alcohol to sip to relax beforehand .
A few moments later she was putting a whisky tumbler into his hand .
How much it meant to us when she brought her Waterford tumbler up onto the stage with her , settled her feathers and her sequins and then looked calmly round until there was complete silence .
In his study , Adam , wearing a dinner jacket , poured whisky into a cut-glass tumbler and confronted his brother .
At supper , now they were thirteen , they were allowed one tumbler , well watered .
The third , a shopkeeper and a victim of circumstance , toyed nervously with his whisky tumbler and prayed desperately for an opportunity to slip away and feed his camel .
Ray Plummer filled the Waterford crystal tumbler with soda and ice and handed it to John Hitch , and then repeated the procedure , passing the other brandy and soda to Terry Morton .
Partly filling an exquisite crystal tumbler , he pressed the prismed top back into the decanter 's neck , and sank into one of the leathern fireside chairs .
A cut glass tumbler sat on the coffee table beside a bottle of gin and a bottle of tonic water .
She laid them out in a precise circle on the polished dining table , the ` Yes " and ` No " cards opposite each other , then placed a glass tumbler upside down in the centre .
His face lit up , he put his plastic tumbler down on the mantelpiece .
A plastic tumbler containing toothbrush and paste stood on a deeper shelf behind two thin metal rails designed to prevent things falling off .
Howard lights a fire of the pine logs he has cut , and they sit in front of it with tumblers of neat Irish whiskey .
